comments.commentBody: What happens in Cleveland stays in Cleveland
Don't forget how the 9/11 Commission white-washed the Bush people. We need a Watergate special prosecutor Archibald Cox style to get to the truth. Then Congress to do its duty.

Two things we know for sure
1. He has a bad memory when it comes to anything that happened that might reflect badly on him.

2. He lied to Congress.

AG Sessions reminds me of a person from the era when telling racist or misogynist jokes around his Congressional buddies was funny. He probably still tells those jokes but only while among his "pixie" loving circle. Who's the punchline now AG Sessions? Do America a solid and resign. Mrs Scott-King had you pegged a long time ago.

Well, I suppose that you know that climate change is a Chinese hoax, Muslims in Patterson NJ were jumping with joy on 9/11, and Obama was born in Kenya. Maybe Trumpsters should take a course or two in epistemology, science, or basic logic.
Actually, it's the Obama smoke machine. Those media outlets are merely blowing the smoke on Obama's behalf.

Let’s not forget the likelihood of human stupidity and incompetence playing its part here. But even if that accounts for 90% of the suspicious contacts between Trump’s players and the Russians, the other 10% is of grave concern. It was a very close election. Putin’s minions were probably messing with our election just to hobble Hillary Clinton’s administration. When they succeeded beyond their hopes, the 10% of these contacts became much more serious.
One of the features of a "witch hunt" is that it catches a witch. It's all about how one defines "witch."

Folks, this is getting serious.  Trump just unleashed a twitter storm that Obama had his phones tapped in Trump Tower.  That, along with his tweet of Schumer and Putin from 2001 indicate that his mental instability is getting worse.  Five weeks into his term and the pressure is making him crack.
And Trump wore a RED tie, which is drop dead proof of his RED connections.
Okay, I finally know what a Natick is, but what is its derivation?

Meanwhile, Governor, our streets are collapsing, the freeway projects the state has started are taking forever to complete--Milwaukee's Zoo Interchange project has been going on since 2010--and the projects you are supposed to be working on aren't even being planned because of your refusal to do anything other than borrow to pay for them.  Cite jobs numbers all you want, but what does it matter if we can't even get to them without destroying our cars?
Walker promised 250,000 new jobs at the end of his first term. He is in year 7 and still hasn't gotten them.

"Cite jobs numbers all you want, but what does it matter if we can't even get to them without destroying our cars?"

That is called "lemon socialism", privatizing the rewards while socializing the losses:

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lemon_socialism

"Socialism for the rich and capitalism for the poor" dates back to Andrew Jackson, who so-called President Trump likes to think he is channeling.

REAL socialism is inherently anti-corporate because it by the people for the people.

https://userctl.com/BlueVsRed/036.png

And don't bring up the Soviet Union or China, totalitarian states pretending to be socialistic. That is communism, not socialism.

Just ask Sweden!

All to do about...EVERYTHING! Probably from the beginning of Political Hacking many, many thousands of years ago, political parties have tried to gain the edge over the apposition. This is natural; Not necessarily the honest way to do things. So–why the big deal now? My guess would be the outcome of an election between two political parties in a dog fight for control of ideology for maybe the next 10 to 20 years. Neither candidate was really popular with the American public. It became again, the lesser of two evils. Then something very strange happened. Donald Trump, whom almost every Republican leader assumed would NEVER win the Primary actually won. That put the Republican Party in flux. Most of them had to support Trump even if they really disliked him because if they didn't support him, that could and probably would have been the end of their political career. OK, that's all ancient history. So why the big deal about meeting with our biggest adversary prior to an election of this importance? If you're a Republican: Nothing! If you're a Democrat, Independent or free thinker? Everything. You be the judge!
Thank you for this legislative update. Our press should publicize these bills.

The Trumpians don't seem to get it.  It is the continued denials of contacts with the Russians, despite incontrovertible proof otherwise, and not the contacts themselves that give the appearance of some sort of wrongdoing.  Investigate, report and move-on.
Lock him up!

He didn't win in a landslide.  There is something fishy. Trump needs to show his tax returns . This will eliminate all the speculation about his financial exposure to Russian money. Why does he hide this?

Just curious.

How many contacts did the Clinton campaign have with Russian officials?

What was the total amount paid to the Clintons by Russian interests, either through speaking fees or donations to the Clinton Slush Fund?

One candidate has a history of accepting large sums of money from Russians and one does.

The pretend outrage is not just a little hypocritical.
Hillary released her tax returns. When Donald does the same perhaps we can begin to put this behind us. I'm not betting on it!

Obama and democrats have no real evidence of wrongdoing so they have made this about whether or not meetings took place. Their problem is that democrats are in the same boat, having met with the ambassador, forgotten about it and claimed otherwise.

Expect the next set of leaks to come out now that this set is losing its steam.

According to this article China doesn't want to do anything that would lead to the collapse of the North Korean regime, presumably because China would have to deal with all of those poor North Koreans left behind. But if China collaborated with the South Korean government (I know that government is not exactly the most stable right now) the North Korean people could quickly become integrated into the South's very prosperous economy and everyone might live happily ever after. Just a pipedream maybe, but better than all out nuclear war. My view of the global map shows that China and Russia are closest targets if and when North Korea decides to show its might. And from what we have seen of the behavior of the current North Korean leadership, human lives, especially Korean lives, are not worth much.

Mutually assured destruction, the nuclear stalemate that has kept us out of a nuclear war for seven decades is still the best policy. Returning nuclear weapons to South Korea sounds like the best option since the technical ones, bombing launch sites and antimissile defenses are largely ineffective.

Kim Jong Un is the Hideki Tojo of today.  North Korea's nuclear and missile programs are a threat our 45th President must face sooner rather than later.  North Korea's reach of its current weapons would put the United States, Russia and most of the world within range of North Korean nuclear warheads. Tweets by President Trump don't mean diddly - and beefing up the military by billions of dollars won't affect nuclear warheads aimed towards the east and west by the Kim empire.  Anti-missile systems won't protect the continental US. Kim's ICBM program is a target for cyberwarfare, electronic attack and new ways and means to deflect enemy strikes.  President Trump will have to face this threat sooner or later in his bizarre off-the-rails administration.
I feel confident that our President will address this very delicate situation with the utmost dispassion and careful evaluation of the no, I'm sorry, I can't. I just can't. We're screwed.

Our troops are there first to threaten China.

We now insist on placing the same kind of missile defense systems in South Korea that have caused such controversy in Europe with the Russians.

Make no mistake, China sees this as aggression toward China and that is likely the primary reason we want to put them there. We think we are being tough.

Our foreign policy strategy is a Cold War strategy that hasn't changed in too many decades.

We need a China policy for the 21st century that does not start with the premise that we must "contain" them.

The U.S. continues to obsess about missiles because, in a strange way, that approach makes us feel safer. North Korea should be deterred from launching one at us or our allies because the consequences would be devastating--although China, South Korea and Japan might not be thrilled with nuclear bombs detonating in their part of the world. And maybe with our superior technology we could actually shoot a missile down with laser guided weapons.

But if a nuclear weapon is used against the U.S., it will be delivered in a suitcase or a Chevy van parked in the middle of Times Square, not on the tip of a missile. No obvious attacker, ergo, no deterrence. Diplomacy is the only way out of our quandary. Stop focusing on missile capabilities and start thinking about motives. Trump's "us against the world" approach can only end badly. We'll only truly be safe when we can honestly say that no country on earth would be better off with the United States destroyed.

So we have a president who appears as unhinged and impulsive as Kim Jong-un running through the options to contain North Korea's nuclear strike reach with the likes of Steve Bannon who believes a big war with China is our manifest destiny. Two months into this darkly surreal administration a 3 a.m. tweet like "I'm gonna let Kim have it! This will make your head spin!" would not be surprising. My near-term predication is a flurry of start-ups in fall-out shelters funded with the tax cuts the GOP intends to bestow on its corporate donor class.
